choices.A: It gives an error on compilation because it should be a statement-level trigger.
choices.C: It gives an error on compilation because of the commit command in the trigger code.

discussion.content: correct: C. It gives an error on compilation because of the commit command in the trigger code. We can not use DCL statements in side the Triggers.

comments.content:
CREATE TABLE audit_cust (
 user_name VARCHAR2(50),
 change_time DATE,
 cust_id NUMBER,
 old_credit_limit NUMBER,
 new_credit_limit NUMBER
);
/

Table AUDIT_CUST created.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER tr_audit_cust AFTER
 UPDATE OF salary ON emp1
 FOR EACH ROW
BEGIN
 INSERT INTO audit_cust (
 user_name,
 change_time,
 cust_id,
 old_credit_limit,
 new_credit_limit
 ) VALUES (
 user,
 sysdate,
 :old.employee_id,
 :old.salary,
 :new.salary
 );

 COMMIT;
END;
/

Trigger TR_AUDIT_CUST compiled

UPDATE emp1
SET
 salary = NULL
WHERE
 department_id = '20';
/

ORA-04092: cannot COMMIT in a trigger
ORA-06512: at "HR.TR_AUDIT_CUST", line 16
ORA-04088: error during execution of trigger 'HR.TR_AUDIT_CUST'

D is correct.
